page.title: 01FROM CLEEKIMIN TO BONGATE
page.content: The area north of Jedburgh to the Cleekimin corner,and from Tudhope to the Roman road,is mainly forested and agricultural. Most farms have cattle and sheep,with crops grown as feedstuffs. The forested area is chiefly Lanton Wood,but there are trees growing all over the area,with hedges between the fields and small plantations. The months of July and August 1985 are proving the worst months in memory for rainfall.Some farms have still not got their hay in at the end of August.The constant rain is making the fields very muddy,and Combines are getting bogged down.Some small farmers may not recover from the financial disaster. Tourists are still calling in bus and car at the Kiltmakers and Edinburgh Woollen Mill,but the daily rain is affecting the tourist trade.
